packagegui.name: parentalcontrolprofiles
packagegui.title: Services: Keekar's Parental Control: Profiles

field.description:
Maximum internet time per day in minutes (shared across ALL devices in this profile).
Example: 120 = 2 hours per day
Leave empty for no limit.

Extra minutes allowed on weekends (Friday-Saturday).
Example: 60 = 1 extra hour on weekends
This is added to the daily limit.

Maximum internet time per week in minutes (optional).
Example: 840 = 14 hours per week
Leave empty to use only daily limits.

Add all devices for this child. Time limits apply across ALL devices combined.
Example: If Emma has an iPad and iPhone both in this profile with 2 hour limit, she gets 2 hours total across both devices, not 2 hours per device.

Tip: Use the "Quick Select" dropdown to auto-populate device information from your network.

Need to add blocked time schedules?
Go to the KACI-PC-Schedule tab to manage bedtime, school hours, and other time-based blocking.
Note: KACI-PC-Schedules are separate from pfSense's built-in Schedules.

Minutes of warning before blocking when time limit is reached.
During grace period, devices can still access internet.
Leave empty to use global setting.

Time when daily counters reset. 24-hour format: HH:MM
Examples: 00:00 (midnight), 06:00 (6am), 18:00 (6pm)
Leave empty to use global setting (midnight).
